title: What is this handwritten font used for Head and Shoulders?
content:
Hello!

Looking for some help identifying this font please. I have a feeling it might be custom but was just wondering if anyone had a better idea?

Appreciate any help on this.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-02-02%20at%2011_5910.36.07.png)

Font: 

 Rollerscript 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2015-02-02 at 11.36.07.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-02-02%20at%2011.36.07.png) | 10.59 KB |
author: mcfee

comments.content: At most Sphere and FG Elise are similar fonts

Was about to say "handwritten as the 2 /e are different" but it's [Rollerscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/g-type/rollerscript) using alternate / [e](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/g-type/rollerscript/smooth/glyphs.html#glyphs/556792/378) and a possible alternate /s or /st ligature I was not able to find.

It looks like they took the first 's' from the ['ss' ligature](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/g-type/rollerscript/smooth/glyphs.html#glyphs/556792/608).

- Lex
Thanks Lex. Saw this one but thought it could have been something a bit easier. Or maybe it's a alternative version of Rollerscript and exclusive for 'Head & Shoulders'...

No, that is Rollerscript Smooth with ligatures and contextual alternates activated; that's how it should be used.

If you want to buy it plase get it here:  
 [http://www.g-type.com/rollerscript-font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070216/http:/www.g-type.com/rollerscript-font "http://www.g-type.com/rollerscript-font")

Thanks, Nick Cooke, designer of this typeface.
Oh thanks guys Rollerscript it is then! Apologies for the delay in reply but appreciate your help :)
